page.title: 03HADHAM HALL ESTATE cont.
page.content: back ownership of the estate and was made Earl Of Essex by Charles II. After the 1660's much of the mansion was knocked down and the estate divided into three farms. Hadham Hall became a farmhouse for tenant farmers,and remained so for over 200 years. In 1900 the estate was sold to Hugenot businessman William Minet. He rebuilt the mansion and added to the outbuildings. In both World Wars Hadham Hall was used to house army personel on training coures. Finally daughter Susan Minet sold the hall to the Hertfordshire County Council and a secondary school, with room for about 30 male boarders was opened in 1952.In 1985 Hadham Hall School contains about 400 pupils.
